global_flags.description: the  type of input remark parser. Required.  * yaml: The tool will parse YAML remarks.  * bitstream: The tool will  parse bitstream remarks.
style.   * human: Human-readable textual report. Default option.  * json: JSON report.

subcommands.name: In
subcommands.description: most  common  use-cases file_a and file_b will be remarks output by compiling a fixed source with differing compilers  or  differing  opti‚Äê mization settings.

subcommands.name: Takes
subcommands.description: a  YAML  remark file as input, and reserializes that file in the bitstream format.

subcommands.name: The
subcommands.description: tool contains utilities to filter the remark count based on remark name, pass name, argument value and remark type.  OPTIONS -------

subcommands.name: annotation-count
subcommands.description: Collect count information from annotation remarks (uses AnnotationRemarksPass)

subcommands.name: bitstream2yaml
subcommands.description: Convert bitstream remarks to YAML remarks

subcommands.name: count
subcommands.description: Collect remarks based on specified criteria. instruction-count - Function instruction count information (requires asm-printer remarks)

subcommands.name: llvm-remarkutil
subcommands.description: count   counts   remarks   <https://llvm.org/docs/Re‚Äê marks.html>  based on specified properties.  By default the tool counts remarks based on how many occur in a source file or function  or  total for the generated remark file.  The tool also supports collecting count based on specific remark arguments. The specified arguments should have an integer value to be able to report a count.

subcommands.name: remarks
subcommands.description: encode  the  number  of instructions in a function at assembly printing time.

subcommands.name: size-diff
subcommands.description: Diff instruction count and stack size remarks between two remark files

subcommands.name: yaml2bitstream
subcommands.description: Convert YAML remarks to bitstream remarks
